item.title: Pirates Outlaws II: Heritage launches in Early Access on December 4 for PC, later in December for iOS and Android
item.content:encoded:
Roguelike deckbuilder sequel Pirates Outlaws II: Heritage will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on December 4, followed by PC via Epic Games Store, and iOS and Android later in December, developer Fabled Game Studio announced.

“In the Early Access version, your adventure starts in The New Elysia,” reads the announcement. “Navigate with heroes and classes, build your deck, sail from isle to isle, and defeat enemies. Conquest the Arena to be a reputed captain.”

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Pirates Outlaws II: Heritage is a roguelike deckbuilder card game. Collect and fuse cards to evolve, gather relics for outfit bonus and design your own strategy. Become reputed, loot the Sea Masters, challenge giant creatures and triumph the great Arena!

Key Features

  • Exclusive Journey – In the family mansion, prepare for your expedition by selecting a pre-made character starter deck, complete with unique hero ability cards. These abilities are acquired and unlocked through various alchemy potions.
  • Adventure with Companions – Recruit companions and add their unique ability cards to your starter deck. Create complementary strategies!
  • Explore Endless Seas – During your journey, carefully plan your route and rations to avoid sinking. Navigate freely from battle to battle or return to any previously visited island, tavern, or market.
  • Search for Deep-Sea Treasures – The game features a vast collection of cards and relics, as well as a wide range of enemies and creatures to defeat.
  • Fusion of Cards – Each card offers various upgrade options. When you collect three identical cards, they fuse to create a higher level one.
  • Unlocking Mystic Powers – Relics provide effects that enhance the bearer. You can find them during events or purchase them in the market. Complete an outfit to gain its passive effect.
  • Customized Appearance – After each expedition, use the gold you’ve earned to unlock and customize characters’ appearance.

Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake opens at 413,518 retail sales.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of October 27, 2025 to November 2, 2025.

Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake was the highest selling new game release, opening at 232,250 units on Switch, 96,812 units on PlayStation 5, and 84,456 units on Switch 2 for an opening week total of 413,518 retail copies sold.

Also new this week, Tales of Xillia Remastered debuted at 10,370 sales on Switch and 7,290 sales on PlayStation 5 for an opening week total of 17,660 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 83,825 units, the Switch family sold 26,708 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 7537 units, the Xbox Series family sold 309 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 19 units.
